CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 3, 1962, page 11A, reads: "SO RE LITs - Photographed with a picture of Mrs. Harriett Lee, who founded the So Re Lit Club 50 years ago, are the members of the smart social club, which celebrated its golden anniversary last Saturday at Bethesda United Presbyterian Church. Left to right, seated: Mrs. Nathan Waters, Mrs. Helen Sterling Robinson, recording secretary; Mrs. C. L. Mellon, Mrs. Charlotte Eckstein, Mrs. John H. Wood, treasurer, and Mrs. Allen Lee, daughter-in-law of the founder. Standing: Mmes. John Harley, Hilda O. Woodruff, parliamentarian; Herbert Simmons, Lenard Hardy, Joseph Price, Emmet F. Davis, president; Alfred Rector, Theodore Greene, corresponding secretary; Alice Jefferson, Thomas Bolden and Russell Robinson. Mrs. Viola Thomas is missing from the picture; also Mrs. Lillian Jones of Asbury Park, N.J."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of seventeen women, members of the So Re Lit Club, left to right, seated: Mrs. Waters, Helen Sterling Robinson, Mrs. C. L. Mellon, Charlotte Eckstein, Mrs. Wood, and Mrs. Lee; standing: Mrs. Harley, Hilda O. Woodruff, Mrs. Simmons, Mrs. Hardy, Mrs. Price, Mrs. Davis, Mrs. Rector, Mrs. Greene, Alice Jefferson, Mrs. Bolden, and Mrs. Robinson, posed behind table with point lace tablecloth, silver tea and coffee service, cake in the shape of open book, and portrait of Harriett Lee, at the Bethesda Presbyterian Church
